metadata.title: CVE-2014-7902 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in PDFium, as used in Google Chrome before39.0.2171.65, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted PDF document.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064
chromium-browser-l10n - 39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064
chromium-chromedriver - 39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '39.0.2171.65-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1064').
